H0.text: Ionic compounds are the compounds that form crystals instead of molecules.

H1.text: Metallic compounds form crystals instead of molecules.

H2.text: Soluble compounds are the compounds that form crystals instead of molecules.

H3.text: Magnetic compounds are compounds that form crystals instead of molecules.

A4.text: Individual ions within a salt usually have multiple near neighbours, so they are not considered to be part of molecules, but instead part of a continuous three-dimensional network.

A5.text: This revealed that there were six equidistant nearest neighbours for each atom, demonstrating that the constituents were not arranged in molecules or finite aggregates, but instead as a network with long-range crystalline order.
